Table.name: SCHED_STASK
Table.commentInRDBMS: Scheduled Maintenance Task: This is node in the GEN-SPEC event construct. It defines the actual scheduled tasks, either preventive or corrective.

Column.name: SCHED_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT (with GEN classification of EVENT_TYPE_CD = 'TS'). Primary key is transcribed onto this entity.

Column.name: SCHED_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT (with GEN classification of EVENT_TYPE_CD = 'TS'). Primary key is transcribed onto this entity.

Column.name: H_SCHED_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to SCHED_STASK. Points to the higest task that is not a check or work order. This will be null for checks and work orders.

Column.name: H_SCHED_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to SCHED_STASK. Points to the higest task that is not a check or work order. This will be null for checks and work orders.

Column.name: TASK_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to TASK_TASK. The baseline task definition of this task.

Column.name: TASK_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to TASK_TASK. The baseline task definition of this task.

Column.name: FAULT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to SD_FAULT. Identifies the fault that this task is a corrective action for.

Column.name: FAULT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to SD_FAULT. Identifies the fault that this task is a corrective action for.

Column.name: TASK_PRIORITY_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ref_task_priority. Indicates the priority of a task as given by the line contoller/supervisor.

Column.name: TASK_PRIORITY_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ref_task_priority. Indicates the priority of a task as given by the line contoller/supervisor.

Column.name: TASK_CLASS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_CLASS. Identifies the class of the task, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: TASK_CLASS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_CLASS. Identifies the class of the task definition, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: TASK_SUBCLASS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_SUBCLASS. Identifies the subclass for this task, which is used to categorize tasks and help with reporting.

Column.name: TASK_SUBCLASS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_SUBCLASS. Identifies the subclass for this task, which is used to categorize tasks and help with reporting.

Column.name: RO_VENDOR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_VENDOR. Used when this task represents a repair order. This identifies the vendor/mro that is performing the repair activity.

Column.name: RO_VENDOR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_VENDOR. Used when this task represents a repair order. This identifies the vendor/mro that is performing the repair activity.

Column.name: ORIG_PART_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_PART_NO. The part number prior to the task being completed (if there is a transformation, the part number will change after the task is competed).

Column.name: ORIG_PART_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_PART_NO. The part number prior to the task being completed (if there is a transformation, the part number will change after the task is competed).

Column.name: TASK_ORIGINATOR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_ORIGINATOR.

Column.name: TASK_ORIGINATOR_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_TASK_ORIGINATOR.

Column.name: MAIN_INV_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The main inventory of the task.

Column.name: MAIN_INV_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The main inventory of the task.

Column.name: RECEIVE_COND_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_RECEIVE_COND.

Column.name: RECEIVE_COND_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_RECEIVE_COND.

Column.name: REPAIR_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The Repair Quantity will be defaulted to the batch?s bin quantity, but it is editable as long as the WO has not started yet. When the WO is started, if the repair quantity is smaller than the bin quantity, then Maintenix will split the batch and create a new batch for the repair quantity.

Column.name: TASK_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A lable used to mark any external reference for the task (Tech Pub link, FK in external system , etc...)

Column.name: MIN_PLAN_YIELD_PCT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This percentage value applied to deadline interval with respect to the task due date indicates a starting point of an optimal planning window.

Column.name: ISSUE_ACCOUNT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is foreign key to FNC_ACCOUNT. All aircraft in the system must have an issue to account.

Column.name: ISSUE_ACCOUNT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is foreign key to FNC_ACCOUNT. All aircraft in the system must have an issue to account.

Column.name: ISSUED_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The local time the task was issued.

Column.name: ISSUED_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The GMT the task was issued.

Column.name: WARRANTY_NOTE
Column.commentInRDBMS: This attribute identifies any warranty information associated with the task.

Column.name: WO_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column indicates the internal work order number for a task.

Column.name: WO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The Work Order under which a task was completed.

Column.name: WO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The Work Order under which a task was completed.

Column.name: ROUTINE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Specifies whether this task is considered "routine" work or not. The routine flag is typically used for reporting purposes.

Column.name: REQUEST_PARTS_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean indicating where or not parts have been requested. Only applies to checks or work orders.

Column.name: RESOURCE_SUM_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Specifies whether this Task summarizes the resource requirements of it's sub-Tasks or it contains the resource requirements.

Column.name: ADHOC_RECUR_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to indicate whether a task that is not based on a task definition is recurring.

Column.name: AUTO_COMPLETE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Defines if a task will be auto completed once all it's child tasks have been completed.

Column.name: CORR_FIX_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates whether a corrective task actually fixed the originating problem.

Column.name: INSTRUCTION_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to record the instructions for a task. This column will be copied from the baseline task definition.

Column.name: VENDOR_WO_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: The coorespondent for the Work Order of an external repair shop.

Column.name: WO_COMMIT_LINE_ORD
Column.commentInRDBMS: Order of the last task in a commited check or work order.

Column.name: RO_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: TASK_LOCK_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Tasks can be downloaded via the Portable Detached Adaptor into Maintenix. These tasks are marked as locked via this field.

Column.name: PREVENT_LPA_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column allows you to prevent line planning automation to make any changes to this work package.

Column.name: EST_DURATION_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is an estimated duration of the task.

Column.name: HEAVY_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Boolean that when flagged, denotes that this a heavy check.

Column.name: SOFT_DEADLINE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This flag indicates whether all deadlines on the task will be considered 'soft'.

Column.name: COLLECTION_REQUIRED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates that the workscope task's job card has been physically collected.

Column.name: INIT_EXP_COST_LOCKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This Boolean field denotes whether the initial expected costs have been locked down for the work package. This is a mandatory field that defaults to 0.

Column.name: EXP_COST_LOCKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This Boolean field denotes whether the expected costs have been locked down for the work package. This is a mandatory field that defaults to 0.

Column.name: ACTUAL_COST_LOCKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This Boolean field denotes whether the actual costs have been locked down for the work package. This is a mandatory field that defaults to 0.

Column.name: TOOLS_READY_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This flag indicates that tools required for the maintenance task are ready when set to 1, we are still awaiting tools if set to 0

Column.name: PARTS_READY_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This flag indicates that parts required for the maintenance task are ready when set to 1, we are still awaiting parts if set to 0.

Column.name: LRP_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identify if this work package is an LRP published work package.

Column.name: ETOPS_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: True is the task is ETOPS significant.

Column.name: ORPHAN_FRCT_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identifies if the task is an orphaned forecasted task.

Column.name: PREVENT_DEADLINE_SYNC_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates whether this task has manual scheduling enabled.

Column.name: SCHED_HR_MULT_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is a factor set on a work package that account for inefficiencies in executing this work package. It applies to the Scheduled Labour Hours.

Column.name: ADJUSTED_BILLING_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is used to mark whether a task has been adjusted for billing hours for each labor skill on a task.

Column.name: REPL_SCHED_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: A reference to the replacement part requirement for replacement tasks and their sub-tasks.

Column.name: REPL_SCHED_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: A reference to the replacement part requirement for replacement tasks and their sub-tasks.

Column.name: REPL_SCHED_PART_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: A reference to the replacement part requirement for replacement tasks and their sub-tasks.

Column.name: HIST_BOOL_RO
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is a copy of evt_event.hist_bool that will be kept in sync by database triggers. The column is read-only and must be updated through evt_event instead.

Column.name: ALT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS:
The alternate key is useful for identifying a specific row in the database when dealing with integrations and Maintenix front ends. The alternate key can is unique to each entity and acts as a surrogate key.

The alternate key is intended to be system generated.

Column.name: RSTAT_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: CREATION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was inserted.

Column.name: REVISION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was last updated.

Column.name: REVISION_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database identifer (MIM_LOCAL_DB) captured at the time the record was last updated. Identifies where modifications are being made in distributed Maintenix.

Column.name: REVISION_USER
Column.commentInRDBMS: The user that last modified the record. The user is either a) the user that logged into Maintenix - pushed into the database from the client or b) if the record update is not via a Maintenix application, the user is the Oracle user name that is processing the transaction.
